channel.title: Posts on Robert Killgore Kentucky Sports Data Project
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Robert Killgore Kentucky Sports Data Project

item.title: How does Kentucky's total turnovers and steals compare to the rest of the SEC
item.description: Any basketball fan knows steals are good and turnovers are bad. If a team force a lot of turnovers in a given game, they steal away their opponents precious possessions and increase the likelihood of winning that game. Let’s see how well Kentucky kept care of the ball and how well they wrecked havoc on the defensive end. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.

item.title: What does Kentucky's cumulative point differential mean?
item.description: The bluebloods of college basketball were not their usual selves this season, Kentucky being the most disappointing of them all. The Wildcats went 9-16 this year and finished 8-9 in conference play, missing the NCAA tournament for the first time since 2013. To begin looking at what went wrong for Kentucky this season, let’s start by grabbing the games logs for each team. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.

item.title: R Notebook
item.description: This is an R Markdown Notebook. When you execute code within the notebook, the results appear beneath the code. Try executing this chunk by clicking the Run button within the chunk or by placing your cursor inside it and pressing Cmd+Shift+Enter. plot(cars) Add a new chunk by clicking the Insert Chunk button on the toolbar or by pressing Cmd+Option+I. When you save the notebook, an HTML file containing the code and output will be saved alongside it (click the Preview button or press Cmd+Shift+K to preview the HTML file).
